description: Champernowne sequence: write n in base 3 and juxtapose.
comments: Essentially the same as A003137. [From _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 29 2009]An irregular table in which the n-th row lists the base 3 digits of n. - _Jason Kimberley_, Dec 07 2012The base 3 Champernowne constant: it is normal in base 3. - _Jason Kimberley_, Dec 07 2012

mathematica: almostNatural[n_, b_] := Block[{m = 0, d = n, i = 1, l, p}, While[m <= d, l = m; m = (b - 1) i*b^(i - 1) + l; i++]; i--; p = Mod[d - l, i]; q = Floor[(d - l)/i] + b^(i - 1); If[p != 0, IntegerDigits[q, b][[p]], Mod[q - 1, b]]]; Array[ almostNatural[#, 3] &, 105, 0] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jun 29 2014 *)
